verbLexeme: 1. To be the type of weather in which the currents of air move rapidly and strongly. English = (be) windy.
2. To be a low temperature, but not cold. English = (be) cool, (be) fresh.
3. To become a low or lower temperature, but not cold. English = cool, cool down, freshen.
4. (When talking of the inside of a building) to be open and fresh. English = (be) airy.
nominalLexeme: 1. A current of air moving across the earth's surface which you can feel blowing past your body, especially your face. English = wind.
oldEntry: Popular explanation: 'fanning oneself in imitation of the wind'.
